meanings.definition: A large ground squirrel of the genus Marmota, typically found in mountainous regions.
meanings.sent2: I saw a group of marmots playing in the rocks.
meanings.sent3: The marmots had a picnic on the hill.
meanings.sent4: The marmots peeked out from their burrows like curious neighbors.
meanings.sent5: The fluffy marmots stood out against the rocky terrain.

meanings.definition: A burrowing rodent with a thickset body and short legs, native to North America and Eurasia.
meanings.sent2: Marmots are known for their burrowing skills.
meanings.sent3: The marmots had a race to see who could dig the fastest.
meanings.sent4: The marmots' burrows were like cozy homes in the earth.
meanings.sent5: The chubby marmots waddled around the field.
